Get a View that displays the data at the specified position in the data set. You can either * create a View manually or inflate it from an XML layout file. When the View is inflated, the * parent View (GridView, ListView...) will apply default layout parameters unless you use * {@link android.view.LayoutInflater#inflate(int, android.view.ViewGroup, boolean)} * to specify a root view and to prevent attachment to the root.
The position of the item within the adapter's data set of the item whose view we want.
The position of the item within the adapter's data set of the item whose view * we want.
The old view to reuse, if possible
The old view to reuse
The parent that this view will eventually be attached to

size Multiplier
model may occasionally be null, so to enforce that load() was called, put a boolean rather // than relying on model not to be null.

If we're the application level request manager, we may be created on a background thread. // In that case we cannot risk synchronously pausing or resuming requests, so we hack around the // issue by delaying adding ourselves as a lifecycle listener by posting to the main thread. // This should be entirely safe.
Indicates that target's visibility can be relaxed to avoid synthetic methods.

The return value of getAllocationByteCount silently changes for recycled bitmaps from the // internal buffer size to row bytes * height. To avoid random inconsistencies in caches, we // instead assert here.
The return value of getAllocationByteCount silently changes for recycled bitmaps
Enables or disables adjustment of view bounds on the main image
Sliding Tab Strip
Allows complete control over the colors drawn in the tab layout

An exposed registry instance that holds a reference to the instrumentation running in the process * and its arguments. Also provides an easy way for callers to get a hold of instrumentation, * application context and instrumentation arguments Bundle.
Provides the primary interface for test authors to perform actions or asserts on views
